result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernest F Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ernest F Green is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ernest F Green was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------------

Comply with any treatment/programming deemed appropriate by Agent.
Reimburse Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit for "buy money" in the amount of $900.00.
-------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED that the time for deciding the defendant's postconviction motion is extended to March 21, 2022. See Wis.Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a).
Defendant's Motion to Extend Time Limits
Exhibit list from Machner Hearing on October 1, 2021 - Exhibit #1 - Zip Drive stored in the Clerk of Courts Exhibit Room (ms)
Oral ruling on February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ernest F Green in court, in custody with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses Attorneys OFF the record as to number of witnesses, exhibits. Parties get lap top set up for exhibits. 
8:48 a.m. - Matter called on the record. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on Machner Hearing. Court addresses Atty. Ruby as to any preliminary matters. Response by Atty. Ruby as to list of evidence not disclosed provided to the Court and the State. Court addresses Attorney Herrmann as to whether an independent investigation was done as to disclosure. Response/record by Atty. Herrmann that evidence was in co-actors' files.  Court has clerk mark zip drive as Exhibit #1 and list of evidence not disclosed as Exhibit #2. Court receives both exhibits pending testimony/evidence.
8:53 a.m. - Atty. Ruby calls Attorney Lane Fitzgerald who is duly sworn by the Court. Before testimony, Court has colloquy with the defendant as to waiver of attorney/client privilege. Court finds waiver to be free, knowing, and voluntary. Direct examination of witness by Atty. Ruby. Exhibits #3, #4, #5  marked, identified and testified to by the witness. Atty. Ruby moves exhibits #3-#5 into evidence. No objection. Exhibits received. Exhibits #6, #7, #8, #9 marked, identified and testified to by the witness. Atty. Ruby moves exhibits #6 - #9 into evidence. No objection. Exhibits received. Exhibits #10, #11, #12 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. Atty. Ruby moves exhibits #10 - #12 into evidence. No objection. Exhibits received. Exhibits #13, #14, #15, #16 marked, identified and testified to by the witness. Atty. Ruby moves exhibits #13 - #16 into evidence. No objection. Exhibits received. Exhibit #17 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. Atty. Ruby moves exhibit #17 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received.
10:22 a.m. - Court in recess for morning break.
10:41 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Direct exam of Mr. Fitzgerald by Atty. Ruby continues. Exhibits #18, #19 marked, identified and testified to by the witness. Atty. Ruby moves exhibits #18 & #19 into evidence. No objection. Exhibits received.
11:05 a.m. - Cross examination by ADA Herrmann.
11:39 a.m. - Redirect by Atty. Ruby.
11:47 a.m. - No recross. State asks that the witness remain under subpoena in case he needs to recall him. Discussion.
11:49 a.m. - Court in recess for lunch.
1:15 p.m. - Court back in session with same appearances.  Atty Ruby calls Deputy Robert Craig who appears by Zoom and is sworn by the Court.  Deputy Craig responds to direct examination of Atty. Ruby. Exhibit #20, marked, identified and testified to by the witness. Atty. Ruby moves exhibit into evidence. Exhibit received. Exhibits #21 and #22 marked and testified to by the witness. Attorney  Ruby moves exhibits #21 and #22 into evidence. No objection. Exhibits received.  State has no questions. Witness excused.
2:17 p.m. - Record by Atty. Ruby as to his subpoena for Ashley Keller who has failed to appear and asks for material witness warrant. Discussion off the record. Court will issue warrant, will entertain briefing, continuance for Ms. Keller's testimony, and will have Atty. Ruby call his next witness at this time.
2:19 p.m. - Atty. Ruby calls Matthew Brown who is duly sworn by the Court and responds to direct examination of Atty. Ruby. 
2:48 p.m. - Cross examination by ADA Herrmann. Exhibit #23 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. State moves exhibit #23 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received. Cross examination continutes.
2:54 p.m. - Redirect by Atty. Ruby.
2:55 p.m. - Witness excused. Defense rests.  Court in recess to address warrant.
3:01 p.m. - Record by the Court who informs the parties that Ms. Keller did appear this morning at 8:30 a.m. and was turned away as she was experiencing COVID symptoms. Discussion as to continuance for her testimony. Court addresses briefing schedule. Court asks how long to file their brief. Response by the State that it will depend on how soon they can get transcript. Court goes off the record for scheduling.
3:08 p.m. - Court makes record as to off the record discussion regarding scheduling. 
3:09 p.m. - Record by Atty. Ruby as to motion for release. Court will not address that motion until he has made a decision on the Machner issue. Parties have nothing further.
Court in recess.  Oral ruling scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Judgment of Conviction

Post-Conviction Hearing before the Honorable Kristine Drettwan on February 21, 2018
Court Reporter Linda Matoska
Order Denying Postconviction Relief

2:34 pm  Court in session.  Case called.   
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Ernest F Green in court, in custody with Atty Urszula Tempska. 
Matter is on today for the Court to make an oral ruling with regard to a postconviction motion that has been filed by the defense.  
They are asking that Court vacate the conviction and schedule a new trial.  
Court has reviewed the Motion and the State's response.  
Neither Atty has anything to add to their written submissions.  
Court makes record and finds defense has not met their burden of proof.  
They have no shown the Court that there was an error.  
Court is denying to find that JI 140 reduces the State's burden of proof.  
For all reasons stated on the record, the Court denies the defense motion for postconviction relief.  
Atty Tempska will e-file the Order from today's hearing.  DA Wiedenfeld is in agreement with the proposed Order.  
2:41 pm  Court in recess.

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED
Temporary Commitment form filed

9:12 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft Ernest F Green in court, in custody with attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court has reviewed the PSI.
Atty Fitzgerald has reviewed the report with Mr. Green and has some corrections which he recites.  
Deft is currently on a 5 year probation period out of Rock County that begin on February 18th of this year.  
Discussion between Court and Attys concerning deft's Rock County sentence.  
9:17 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Necci.  
9:18 am  Deputy Cory Newmann is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Necci.  
9:25 am  Cross exam by Atty Fitzgerald.  
9:27 am  Questions of Deputy Newmann by Court.  9:28 am  Witness excused.  
9:28 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Necci.  
9:38 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Fitzgerald.  
9:44 am  Statement by Deft.  
9:56 am  Court takes recess to consider this matter and will return at 10:10 am.  
10:17 am  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the deft.  

SENTENCE:  
Count #1 - FIVE years of IC followed by FIVE years ES - consecutive to any other sentence
Count #2 - TWO years of IC followed by TWO years ES - consecutive
Count #3 - TWO years of IC followed by TWO years ES - consecutive
Count #4 - TWO years of IC followed by TWO years ES - consecutive
Count #5 - TWO years of IC followed by TWO years ES - consecutive
Count #6 - TWO years of IC followed by TWO years ES - consecutive
792 days sentence credit (2/13/14 - 4/15/16)

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
1) AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
2) Maintain full time employment
3) Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  Costs to include reimbursement of buy money of $900 to the Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit.  
4) Comply with any treatment / programming deemed appropriate by Agent.
Court makes record and find Defendant NOT eligible for CIP or SAP
10:27 am  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 10-10-2016: COURT REPORTER RHONDA S BOSS**

**EXCERPT TRANSCRIPT FILED 10/13/2016: COURT REPORTER RHONDA S BOSS**
Original filed with court.
Walworth County Sheriff's Department received exhibits 13, 12, 9, 7, 3, 5, 33
Temporary Commitment form filed
Verdict No. 1 - Guilty
Verdict No. 3 - Guilty
Verdict No. 5 - Guilty
Verdict No. 7 - Guilty
Verdict No. 9 - Guilty
Verdict No. 11 - Guilty
Random Listing Report

9:46 am  Court in session with Attys and the Deft.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Ernest F Green in court, in custody with Atty Lane Fitzgerald.  
Court has provided Attys with a set of the Instructions the Court intends to read
Discussion concerning Instructions.  
9:54 am  Jurors seated in courtroom.  
9:55 am  Juror 616 is released as the alternate juror
9:55 am  Court instructs the Jury
9:57 am  Court asks for sidebar with Attys.  
10:07 am  Court continues to instruct the Jury.

10:24 am  Closing argument by Atty Necci.
10:37 am  Closing argument by Atty Fitzgerald.  
10:56 am  Rebuttal argument by Atty Necci. 
11:06 am  Court gives final Instructions.  
11:12 am  Clerk swears in Bailiffs.
11:12 am  Jurors are excused from courtroom to begin their deliberations.  

11:12 am  No objection to the reading of the Instructions.
11:13 am  Court makes a record with regard to sidebar.  
11:13 am  Court in recess.  

11:45 am  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Jurors have 2 questions - requesting Exhibits.  
11:46 am  Atty Necci has no objection to Exhibits 37 & 48 going back.  Atty Fitzgerald objects to Exhibits going back.  
11:47 am  Exhibits 37 and 48 will be provided to Jury.  
11:48 am  Jurors are also asking for organization flow chart, Exhibit 50.  Court is not inclined to send it back and makes record as to reasons.  
11:49 am  Attorney Necci agrees that Exhibit 50 should not go back.  Attorney Fitzgerald objects to Exhibit 50 going back unless a portion of it is blacked-out
11:49 am  Court will draft a written response to the Jurors questions.  Attys are in agreement with Court's written response.  
11:54 am  Court in recess.

2:10 pm  Court in session.  Attys and defendant are present in court. Jury is seated in Courtroom.  
Court addresses Jury foreman about a discrepancy in verdicts.  Juror clarifies the verdict.
Court reads verdicts.  Defendant found guilty on Cts. #1, #2, #3, #4, #5 and #6 of the Information.  
Attorney Fitzgerald asks that Jurors be polled.  Clerk polls jurors.
2:15 pm  Court thanks Jurors for their service and Jury is excused.
Attorney Necci moves for Judgment on the verdicts.
Attorney Fitzgerald objects with no argument.
Court enters Judgment on verdicts.  
Court revokes bond and orders Deft held in custody pending sentencing.
PSI Ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled.  
Sentencing on:  April 15, 2016 at 9:00 a.m. 
2:21 pm  Court in recess.  

**08/17/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Eileen Walsh Grzenia  (df)

8:32 am  Court in session.  Case called.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deft Ernest F Green in court, in custody with Atty Lane Fitzgerald.  
Atty Necci has provided Court with JI 6000
8:34 am  Jury seated in courtroom.
8:34 am  DANIEL METZGER is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Necci.   
8:38 am  Atty Necci plays track from Exhibit 16 (audio recording from controlled purchases).  
8:41 am  Continued exam of Mr. Metzger by Atty Necci.  
8:45 am  Another track from Exhibit 16 is played (9-30-2013 controlled purchase).  
8:48 am  Continued exam of Mr. Metger by Atty Necci.  
8:50 am  Cross exam by Atty Fitzgerald.  
8:52 am  Redirect by Atty Necci.  
8:53 am  Attys have sidebar with Court at request of Atty Necci.  
8:55 am  Jury excused from courtroom.

8:55 am  Argument by Attys as to whether the door has been opened to introduce other acts evidence.  
8:59 am  Court doesn't believe the door was opened.  
9:00 am  Court will allow Atty Necci to ask questions of Mr. Metzger as an offer of proof.  Response by Mr. Metzger to Atty Necci's questions.  
9:01 am  Continued discussion as to permissible testimony.  

9:02 am  Jury returns to courtroom.
9:02 am  Redirect by Atty Necci.  
9:03 am  Atty Fitzgerald moves to be heard.  Jury excused from courtroom.  

9:03 am  Discussion between Court and Attys as to witness' response to question
9:04 am  Atty Fitzgerald moves to strike entirety of Mr. Metzger's testimony.
9:05 am  Response by witness to Court's question.  
9:06 am  Court will strike the question and the answer that was given most recently.  Court will so Instruct the Jury.  

9:07 am  Jury returns to courtroom. Court Instructs the Jury that the last question and answer of witness is being stricken and is not to be considered in their deliberations.  
9:10 am  ALLEN MILES is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Necci.  
9:13 am  Atty Necci publishes 1st audio track from Exhibit 16.  
9:19 am  Continued exam of Mr. Miles by Atty Necci.  
9:22 am  Atty Necci publishes the 2nd audio track from Exhibit 16
9:24 am  Continued exam of Mr. Miles by Atty Necci.  
9:27 am  Attys have discussion with Court off the record.  
9:27 am  Cross exam of Mr. Miles by Atty Fitzgerald.  
9:30 am  Redirect by Atty Necci. 
9:31 am  Recross by Atty Fitzgerald.  
9:31 am  Witness excused.  

9:32 am  JAMES LANGNES is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Necci.  
9:36 am  Cross exam by Atty Fitzgerald.  
9:37 am  Redirect by Atty Necci.  
9:38 am  Recross by Atty Fitzgerald.  
9:40 am  Redirect by Atty Necci.
9:40 am  Recross by Atty Fitzgerald.
9:41 am  Jury excused for a 20 minute break to await State's next witness.  

9:42 am  Court makes record as to two prior sidebars with counsel.  
9:44 am  Court in recess.  

10:00 am  Court in session with Deft and Attys.  
10:00 am  State's witness is not yet here.  Court addresses the issue of the text messages.  
10:03 am  Atty Necci makes offer of proof.
10:10 am  Response by Atty Fitzgerald.  
10:13 am  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  
10:19 am  Court does not believe text messages relate directly to the crimes we are talking about.  
Court believes they are acts and that they are other acts which don't fit within the Dukes Bower exception to the other acts rule.  
10:19 am  Response by Atty Necci as to State's theory of admission - statements by a party opponent.  
10:20 am  Court is not doing the Sullivan analysis at this time because there was no motion timely filed.

**08/17/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Eileen Walsh Grzenia  (df)

3:29 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ernest F Green in court, in custody with attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  Matter is before the Court for Final Pre-trial.  This case is scheduled for a speedy Jury Trial on Monday, February 8th.  Attorney Fitzgerald apologizes for his tardiness.  He had an incorrect time written down for this hearing.  Attorneys confirm this matter is ready to proceed to trial.  Attorney Necci asks for a record that Attorney Fitzgerald requested on 12/4/2015 the discovery be sent to him and that his office be billed.  Attorney Fitzgerald then called and said he didn't need the discovery because he received it from the Public Defender's office.  Attorney Fitzgerald confirms that he chose not to utilize the open file policy of the DA's office and advises he has received all of the discovery.  Attorney Fitzgerald requests a Ludwig hearing.  The State has made an offer which the defendant has rejected.  Attorney Necci makes a record as to the State's offer.  Attorney Fitzgerald has communicated the offer to his client.  Court has colloquy with the Defendant.  He says he is just now hearing about this.  3:32 p.m.  Court takes a recess so that Attorney Fitzsimmons can meet with Mr. Green in the jail holding cell.  3:41 p.m.  Court in session.  Defendant states he now understands the offer and is objecting the offer.  Attorney Fitzgerald has no pre-trial motions.  Court indicates we will seat 2 alternate jurors.  Court asks that State submit jury instructions by Friday at noon and if defense has any specific instructions, they should also be filed.  Court will start at 8:30 a.m. on Monday with Counsel and the Defendant.  Jurors will be asked to report at 8:15 a.m.  Court expects to be able to start jury selection at 9:15 or 9:30 a.m.  No objection by defense to the State having a court officer.  Court denies defendant's request to sequester the State's Court Officer until he testifies.  Court cites authority for the Court Officer to be present at counsel's table in courtroom.  Confirmed for trial.  3:46 p.m.  Court in recess.

3:01 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  
Defendant Ernest F Green in court, in custody with attorney Adam Walsh.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is before the Court on Attorney Walsh's request to withdraw from representation of Mr. Green.  Mr. Green is in agreement with this.  
Court asks Mr. Green what he will do about an Attorney if Attorney Walsh is allowed to withdraw?  
Mr. Green says he will get a new Attorney.   
Court notes this matter is currently set for trial in June but there is a request by the State to adjourn the trial due to the unavailability of an Officer.  
Court notes that Mr. Green filed a grievance against Attorney Walsh.  
Attorney Walsh filed his Motion to Withdraw after having received a letter indicating that the Defendant would be filing a grievance.  
Court grants the Motion to withdraw as counsel.  
Court will contact the Public Defender's office and ask that they contact Mr. Green.  (Note:  Clerk called their office during this hearing)  
Court will schedule a status conference in 3 or 4 weeks.  Court will continue the status to May 27th at 1:15 p.m.  
3:08 p.m.  Court in recess.  
  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
